properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 2 at 12:39AM PST until February 2 at 9:54PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the
following rivers in Washington...

Nooksack River At Ferndale affecting Whatcom County

Showers will decrease this morning. Hydrologically significant
precipitation is not expected for the next couple of days.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Nooksack River At Ferndale
* Until this evening.
* At 12:30 AM Sunday the stage was 20.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 18.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue to rise and crest near 20.7 feet
around 4 AM Sunday. The river will fall below flood stage early
this afternoon.
* Impact...At 20.5 feet, the Nooksack River will overflow levees and
banks along the east bank of the river from Hovander Park
downstream to Marietta, causing widespread flooding from near
Ferndale downstream to the mouth...with swift waters in residential
areas and over farm lands and roads. Erosion may damage some river
banks.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.

NWSheadline: Observed flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity... ...Forecast flooding increased from Minor to Moderate severity
